ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ lɔgɔ tÿǒ manûa, é kwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ; agwǒŋ yelÿò ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó yétʉ̂a, agwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó yétʉ̂a. Ajʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ge láʼ gẅiin pɔ́ tàʼ fʉ̀ʼ na megwǒŋ menzèm; acú piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó yétá.
en: “You   are to construct the altar of acacia wood. The altar must be square, 7 1/2 feet long, and 7 1/2 feet wide;  # 27:1 Lit five cubits in length and five cubits in width it must be 4 1/2 feet high.  # 27:1 Lit wide; and its height three cubits

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ néŋ mendóŋ na mezẅé lekùɔ; mɛ̌ mendóŋ, epú ńtemte ńgwɔ́ tàʼ; mé piŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ḿbwoon.
en: Make horns for it on its four corners; the horns are to be of one piece.   Overlay it with bronze.  # 27:2 Nm 16:38; Ps 118:27

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ nyɛte mekúm lɔg ńtúʼu pfó gie á kẅɛɛ na mejʉʼ mbab membòŋo menɔ̀ɔn, é nyɛte meshú mie nkòonte sag sag, mbɔɔ metétɔ́ʼ mie mé néŋ metse tsoló lélɔg ńzate, mbɔɔ lelúʼmentyɛʼɛ́, ńgÿo púɔ megwág mie mé tuɔ laméndɔ̀ɔn tsoló; mé ge láʼ lɔg pɔ́ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, é nyɛte sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm.
en: Make its pots for removing ashes, and its shovels, basins, meat forks, and firepans; make all its utensils of bronze.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, é páʼ lekÿo mmɔ̌g; é leen ké néŋ mekwáŋ mie mé lɔgɔ́ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte, á na mezẅé lekùɔ.
en: Construct a grate for it of bronze mesh, and make four bronze rings on the mesh at its four corners.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ shÿɔ́g lekÿo tʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mengʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é shÿɔ́gɔ na ntí gie é ge fó tsìŋe ssé, é kwɔ́ʼ tà gebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ cú, na jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: Set it below, under the altar’s ledge,   so that the mesh comes halfway up  # 27:5 Or altar’s rim, so that the grid comes halfway down the altar.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ kwóon mepáŋte pe lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é mepáŋte mie mé lɔgɔ́ tÿǒ manûa ńnyɛte, é leen ké lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ pwoon.
en: Then make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ shÿɔ́g mepáŋte tsɛ̀ɛ mekwáŋ; mepáŋte ge láʼ gwɔ́ na gwǒŋ sépʉ́a na jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ páʼ mé ge lɔg kaa.
en: The poles are to be inserted into the rings so that the poles are on two sides of the altar when it is carried.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ lɔg mepeláŋ tÿɔ́ʼte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ tà soŋ tyé gʉ̀. Ɔ̀ ge láʼ gÿo na ntí gie mé la nyɛɛ gú ndùm lekwɛ́.
en: Construct the altar with boards so that it is hollow. They are to make it just as it was shown to you on the mountain.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ gʉa na ntàb ye Ssé, é nyé tsɔ́ jʉʼ gie mé ge lɔg gÿo tetʉ́a, mé ge gÿo lɔg mepàg nzsǒ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ, é lɔg kéle yɛ̌ tetʉ́a. Mefʉ̀ʼ mé ge láʼ gwɔ́ lemaʼá pwó nkÿo, á na shÿó we ntsíŋ.
en: “You   are to make the courtyard for the tabernacle. Make hangings for the south side of the courtyard out of finely spun linen, 150 feet  # 27:9 Lit 100 cubits, also in v. 11 long on that side

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ lɔg mengwɔ̀b mbɔɔ menkwoŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte, é laa na menkàŋ móm mbʉ́a mie é laa na melʉ̀ʼ mɛ̌ móm mbʉ́a mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte.
en: including twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, with silver hooks and silver bands   for the posts.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gʉa na shÿó we kwóŋ, mé lɔg mengwɔ̀b mbɔɔ menkwoŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte, é la mepàg nzsǒ, e gwɔ́ na fʉ̀ʼ mmó lemaʼá pwó nkÿo na menkàŋ móm mbʉ́a mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte.
en: And so make hangings 150 feet long for the north side, including twenty posts and their twenty bronze bases, with silver hooks and silver bands for the posts.

ngiemboon: Mepàg nzsǒ na gwoŋó tetʉ́a yekʉ́, á na shÿó mbyěnèm ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó móm tʉ̂a. Mɛ̌ mepàg nzsǒ ge láʼ gwɔ́ na menkàŋ legém mie é laa na melʉ̀ʼ mɛ̌ legém.
en: For the width of the courtyard, make hangings 75 feet   long for the west side, including their ten posts and their ten bases.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na gwoŋó tetʉ́a yekʉ́, á na shÿó sǎʼnèm gie mefʉ̀ʼ mé, ée lemaʼá pwó móm tʉ̂a,
en: And for the width of the courtyard on the east side toward the sunrise, 75 feet,

ngiemboon: mé fʉʼ mepàg nzsǒ tà e gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a né legém na tàʼ nkwɔʼɔ́, lâ menkàŋ mé méntá, mbɔɔ melʉ̀ʼ mé méntá,
en: make hangings 22 1/2 feet   long for one side of the gate, including their three posts and their three bases.

ngiemboon: é piŋ gíŋe fʉʼ mepàg nzsǒ lemaʼá pwó ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a né legém na yetsɔ́ gwǒŋ, ńgÿo menkàŋ mé méntá, mbɔɔ melʉ̀ʼ mé méntá.
en: And make hangings 22 1/2 feet long for the other side, including their three posts and their three bases.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na ncwò ntàb we tetʉ́a, mé nyɛte lɔgnkʉ́ŋ na fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó móm mbʉ́a. Mé ge láʼ lɔg nzsǒ gie mé lɔgɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ, é temte na menoŋ njʉ̀njÿò mie é gẅiin liŋé ngénʉ̀ŋ pɔ́ liŋé pepàŋ, mbɔɔ mie é paŋa lê gʉ̂m, é cwoŋte. Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ kwaʼ mmó levfò, lâ menkàŋ lekùɔ mbɔɔ melʉ̀ʼ mɛ̌ lekùɔ.
en: The gate of the courtyard is to have a 30-foot   screen  # 27:16 Ex 35:17; 38:18; 39:40; 40:8,33; Nm 3:26; 4:26 embroidered  # 27:16 Or woven with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen. It is to have four posts and their four bases.

ngiemboon: Menkàŋ ntsèm mie é ge láʼ kéle tetʉ́a, é ge láʼ gẅiin mɔ́b menkwoŋ, mbɔɔ mɔ́b mengwɔ̀b, ńgÿo mɔ́b melʉ̀ʼ. Mengwɔ̀b lâ menkwoŋ ge gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte, melʉ̀ʼ gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte.
en: “All the posts around the courtyard are to be banded with silver and have silver hooks and bronze bases.

ngiemboon: Agwǒŋ yelÿò na tetʉ́a ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó nkÿo, agwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó móm tʉ̂a á na menkwɔʼɔ́ ntsèm, acú piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó yétʉ̂a, ńgẅiin mepàg nzsǒ mie mé lɔgɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ, mbɔɔ melʉ̀ʼ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte.
en: The courtyard is to be 150 feet long, 75 feet wide at each end, and 7 1/2 feet high,   all of it made of finely spun linen. The bases of the posts are to be bronze.

ngiemboon: Eshúm ntsèm sie mé ge lɔg faʼa tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb, epúɔ mekèm tÿǒ mɛ̌ ntsèm, mbɔɔ púɔ mekèm tÿǒ mie ée tetʉ́a, é ge láʼ gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte.
en: All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use and all its tent pegs as well as all the tent pegs of the courtyard are to be made of bronze.

ngiemboon: Gù Mǒonsê, ɔ̀ ge láʼ gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie pɔ́ ná mevɛ́ olive membòŋo mie é lʉ́ate, légwɔ́ gie é ge gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melâm, pɛ̌ melâm, e kyɛʼ jʉʼ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: “You are to command the Israelites to bring you pure oil from crushed olives for the light, in order to keep the lamp burning regularly.

ngiemboon: Áloŋ pâ gubé yé ge láʼ tÿɔ́g melâm á tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb mbumté, á mvfò lɔgnkʉ́ŋ gẅie áa kʉ̀ŋe kʉbé kʉ̀a, légwɔ́ gie é ge kyɛʼ, léfó mbÿɛ̀njÿó, ńgʉa ńkú mbaʼámbaʼ, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Ée lepʉ̌ sie pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ge láʼa tÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ na mejwoŋó mejwoŋó.
en: In the tent of meeting outside the curtain that is in front of the testimony,   Aaron and his sons are to tend the lamp  # 27:21 Ex 26:31,33; 28:43 from evening until morning before the Lord. This is to be a permanent statute  # 27:21 Ex 29:9; Lv 3:17; 16:34; Nm 18:23; 19:21 for the Israelites throughout their generations.
